p: The diagnostic value of Zika virus disease differs between countries and specific population groups. Travelers in high-risk areas or people in contact with an infected person must be screened with a serological blood test. Furthermore, pregnant women with possible Zika virus exposure, with or without symptoms and women who were diagnosed with fetal microcephaly must be tested for Zika virus infection. Exposed neonates should be evaluated with special Zika Outcomes and Development in Infants and Children (ZODIAC) tools. The current protocol of Zika infection management involves only symptomatic care. Due to the serious problems faced by children exposed during pregnancy and their adverse effects on the economy and society, the early diagnosis of exposure is very important [ 15, 16].
